subject: p15131736
History: Year old woman with COPD, CHF hypotension, shortness of breath. Assess for pneumonia, CHF exacerbation.
Findings: The lungs are hypoinflated with crowding of vasculature. There is progression of severe vascular engorgement with peribronchial cuffing as well as bilateral perihilar opacities with interval increase in small left pleural effusion. No right pleural effusion. No pneumothorax. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. A right PICC tip is seen at least up to the low SVC.
Impression: Moderate pulmonary edema with stable moderate cardiomegaly and increased small left pleural effusion. In order to exclude pneumonia a repeat PA and lateral chest radiograph once the edema has resolved should be considered as current underlying parenchymal disease limits evaluation. A right PICC tip is seen at least up to the low SVC.
